author: rjected
content:
So I have had a question with this flavor of `rpc-compat` hive tests for a while - the "invalid" tests like this one:
https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/tests/eth_getStorage/get-storage-invalid-key.io

Is there a place where this error message is defined or standardized? It doesn't seem at all critical to return the exact same error message, but hive just checks the diff of the text returned by the client. I implemented something in our fork of hive, which just checks that the response is an error, ignoring the message. Is this worth a PR? Or is there another take on error conformance that I'm not seeing?
